metatags.twitter:title: Kentucky Enacts Comprehensive Data Privacy Law
metatags.og:title: Kentucky Enacts Comprehensive Data Privacy Law | White & Case LLP
metatags.og:description: On April 4, 2024, Kentucky joined the rapidly growing number of states adopting a comprehensive data privacy law, when Governor Andy Beshear signed, the Kentucky Consumer Data Protection Act ("Kentucky CDPA"). The law will take effect January 1, 2026. In this latest in our series of articles on US State Data Privacy Laws, we summarize the key components of the Kentucky CDPA.

metatags.og:title: Kentucky’s Consumer Privacy Law Is Coming, But on a Slow Track
metatags.og:description: On April 4, 2024, Kentucky Governor Andy Beshear (D) signed the Kentucky Consumer Data Protection Act (“KCDPA”) into law, with a slow roll to the date it takes effect on January 1, 2026. The KCDPA goes a bit easier on businesses and (1) does not impose a requirement to provide a universal opt-out mechanism, and (2) has a permanent cure provision that will afford violators ongoing opportunities to rectify alleged violations of the law. Learn more about the Kentucky Consumer Data Protection Act.

metatags.twitter:title: Kentucky Consumer Data Protection Act: An Overview | Clifford Chance
metatags.twitter:description: On April 4, 2024, Kentucky became the sixteenth state in the U.S. to enact comprehensive data privacy legislation with the Kentucky Consumer Data Protection Act (KYCDPA). The KYCDPA is the third law enacted in 2024, building on last year's momentum in states implementing comprehensive privacy laws.  The KYCDPA takes effect on January 1, 2026.  This article summarizes key provisions of the KYCDPA.
